title: Virgil van Dijk sends title warning to Man City ahead of Liverpool clash with Man Utd
text:

Virgil van Dijk says he's not interested in what Manchester City do as Liverpool have nothing to lose in the Premier League title race.

The Reds went eight points clear with a last-gasp 2-1 win over Leicester City before the international break, and then saw that lead maintained when City surprisingly lost at home to Wolves a day later .

Pep Guardiola's men play first this weekend as they go to Crystal Palace on Saturday evening, with the Reds then able to maintain or improve their lead at the top against Manchester United at Old Trafford on Sunday.

Ahead of that clash, the Dutch defender says the Reds aren't looking over their shoulders.

(Image: Liverpool FC via Getty Images)

"I don't watch Man City's games but I have family and friends who text me or say something, especially after the Wolves game," Van Dijk told Sky Sports .

"That's just part of life but we've learnt from last year that we don't have to look to the others until the end of the campaign.

"So far, we have been doing well but Man City are definitely not going away."

(Image: Getty Images)

Van Dijk added that any pressure being heaped on the Reds isn't being felt at Anfield.

"I don't think we have anything to lose. Man City are the champions, they're defending their title and we want to get it," he continued.

"In my point of view, we just have to go for it.

(Image: Getty Images)

"The pressure gets bigger, but that comes from the media. They love to put more pressure on us and that's something we have to deal with.

"I don't mind because I'm not thinking about what other people say, I just want to win every game that is ahead of me.

"We definitely need to enjoy it [being top of the Premier League] and be full of confidence, especially with the way we've got these points, having not had the best games but still getting the wins."
description: The Dutch defender says he's not interested in Manchester City's matches as Liverpool have nothing to lose this season
